title: Content Security Policy not applied to error pages at multiple HackerOne endpoints

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information: HackerOne CSP "script-src" includes "unsafe-inline" bypass via % and %" ----- **Summary & Description** >We utilize a strict Content Security Policy and a safe-by-default templating language to effectively neutralize Cross-Site Scripting (XSS). >We encrypt all network communications with SSL/TLS accompanied with Perfect Forward Secrecy and HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS), including being HSTS preloaded in most major browsers. base in my finding i found that there was a missing or not included `Content Security Policy` in your website. i bypass a simple `%` or `%"` to reproduce a XSS. like what you said `We utilize a strict Content Security Policy and a safe-by-default templating language to effectively neutralize Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).` and `We encrypt all network communications with SSL/TLS accompanied with Perfect Forward Secrecy and HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS), including being HSTS preloaded in most major browsers.` but in this case i can bypass via inspect element. why am i getting this error or a blank page ? with a simple `%` or `%"` at the and point of a url ? i can bypass your `Content Security Policy` ### Steps To Reproduce at first if you `Inspect element` and `Edit a HTML` at any line you will getting this error >Refused to execute inline event handler because it violates the following Content Security Policy directive: "script-src 'self' www.google-analytics.com". Either the 'unsafe-inline' keyword, a hash ('sha256-...'), or a nonce ('nonce-...') is required to enable inline execution. which is good, but in my case, i can bypass your `Content Security Policy` with `%` or `%"` at the end point of a any url 1. Go to any HackerOne Subdomains 2. add `%` or `%"` at the end point 3. Inspect element and `Edit as HTML` at any line 4. paste the payload, `` 5. now i can bypass your `Content Security Policy` Proof of Concept Video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zMjTgpm-dLE **Tested Websites** >https://hackerone-attachments.s3.amazonaws.com https://api.hackerone.com https://hackerone.com https://www.hackerone.com https://profile-photos.hackerone-user-content.com **Reference** https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Content-Security-Policy/script-src https://www.websec.be/blog/cspreporting/ **Platforms and Tested Browser** Tested in Windows 7 and 10 Google Chrome latest Version Microsoft Edge 40.15063.0.0 **Regards:** WH-PH
vulnerability_information_html:
HackerOne CSP "script-src" includes "unsafe-inline" bypass via % and %"

Summary & Description

We utilize a strict Content Security Policy and a safe-by-default templating language to effectively neutralize Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).

We encrypt all network communications with SSL/TLS accompanied with Perfect Forward Secrecy and HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS), including being HSTS preloaded in most major browsers.

base in my finding i found that there was a missing or not included Content Security Policy in your website. i bypass a simple % or %" to reproduce a XSS. like what you said We utilize a strict Content Security Policy and a safe-by-default templating language to effectively neutralize Cross-Site Scripting (XSS). and We encrypt all network communications with SSL/TLS accompanied with Perfect Forward Secrecy and HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS), including being HSTS preloaded in most major browsers. but in this case i can bypass via inspect element.

why am i getting this error or a blank page ? with a simple % or %" at the and point of a url ? i can bypass your Content Security Policy

Steps To Reproduce

at first if you Inspect element and Edit a HTML at any line you will getting this error

Refused to execute inline event handler because it violates the following Content Security Policy directive: "script-src 'self' www.google-analytics.com". Either the 'unsafe-inline' keyword, a hash ('sha256-...'), or a nonce ('nonce-...') is required to enable inline execution.

which is good, but in my case, i can bypass your Content Security Policy with % or %" at the end point of a any url

  1. Go to any HackerOne Subdomains
  2. add % or %" at the end point
  3. Inspect element and Edit as HTML at any line
  4. paste the payload, <img src=x onerror=alert('Hacker1')>
  5. now i can bypass your Content Security Policy

Proof of Concept Video
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zMjTgpm-dLE

Tested Websites

https://hackerone-attachments.s3.amazonaws.com
https://api.hackerone.com
https://hackerone.com
https://www.hackerone.com
https://profile-photos.hackerone-user-content.com

Reference
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Content-Security-Policy/script-src
https://www.websec.be/blog/cspreporting/

Platforms and Tested Browser

Tested in Windows 7 and 10
Google Chrome latest Version
Microsoft Edge 40.15063.0.0

Regards:
WH-PH

activities.message:
Hello @wh47, we have deployed a fix for the issue you reported.

Can you confirm that the following websites are not vulnerable anymore:
- https://api.hackerone.com
- https://hackerone.com

These are the only site under our control.
activities.markdown_message:
Hello @wh47, we have deployed a fix for the issue you reported.

Can you confirm that the following websites are not vulnerable anymore:

  • https://api.hackerone.com
  • https://hackerone.com

These are the only site under our control.

activities.message: Yes, please note the difference between https://hackerone.com and https://www.hackerone.com. The latter is our marketing site hosted on a third party. That is why I'm only able to fix this issue on https://hackerone.com.
activities.markdown_message: Yes, please note the difference between https://hackerone.com and https://www.hackerone.com. The latter is our marketing site hosted on a third party. That is why I'm only able to fix this issue on https://hackerone.com.

activities.message:
Hey @wh47,

For https://hackerone-attachments.s3.amazonaws.com and https://profile-photos.hackerone-user-content.com, There are no CSP headers served at all. Since there are no pages hosted there, there is no reason for us to have CSP set up there, and a `%` doesn't actually change the response. 

As for https://www.hackerone.com, we'll try to get this implemented by the third party hosting our `www.` subdomain. 

Dirk
activities.markdown_message:
Hey @wh47,

For https://hackerone-attachments.s3.amazonaws.com and https://profile-photos.hackerone-user-content.com, There are no CSP headers served at all. Since there are no pages hosted there, there is no reason for us to have CSP set up there, and a % doesn't actually change the response.

As for https://www.hackerone.com, we'll try to get this implemented by the third party hosting our www. subdomain.

Dirk

activities.message: Can you please explain how the lack of CSP on those pages would be a security vulnerability? Those are static pages so the only way to exploit this would be performing self-XSS, which we don't consider an issue.
activities.markdown_message: Can you please explain how the lack of CSP on those pages would be a security vulnerability? Those are static pages so the only way to exploit this would be performing self-XSS, which we don't consider an issue.

activities.message:
Hi @tomdev :)

like what you've said in your Security Application.

>We utilize a strict Content Security Policy and a safe-by-default templating language to effectively neutralize Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).

im just insuring that there are CSP to your website including static pages, like [Github]
 (https://hackerone.com/github). you have the same policy, even if you go to `https://github.com/%"` they have a CSP there. and a proper redirection to 404 page.

in HackerOne, if you put `%` at the end of any url, you have a blank page and no CSP + no redirection to 404 page.


>**GitHub CSP**
While content-injection vulnerabilities are already in-scope for our GitHub.com bounty, we also accept bounty reports for novel CSP bypasses affecting GitHub.com, even if they do not include a content-injection vulnerability. Using an intercepting proxy or your browser's developer tools, experiment with injecting content into the DOM. See if you can execute arbitrary JavaScript or exfiltrate sensitive page contents such as CSRF tokens. Reports of other previously-unknown impacts from content-injection will also be considered.

in my case, i would like to secure, check any possibilities that there are CSP in any pages in HackerOne. :)

**Regards:**
WH-PH

activities.message:
Hey @wh47,

Thanks for your patience. We are still relying on a third party to get the fix for www.hackerone.com out. We hope they can provide that shortly.

We have taken the multiple websites into account and decided to stick we the bounty we payed you. Exploitability of this issue is very hard and we're only fixing this as a measure of defense-in-depth.
activities.markdown_message:

activities.message:
Hi @wh47 - 

By default HackerOne discloses the full content of the reports unless there is personal or private information contained within. After reviewing this, I don't see anything that needs to be redacted in order for this to be publicly disclosed. Do you feel that there is anything in particular that you want redacted before this is disclosed? If so, please respond with the information you feel needs to be redacted. 

Thanks 
@coffeecup
activities.markdown_message:

After reviewing this, I don't see anything that needs to be redacted in order for this to be publicly disclosed. Do you feel that there is anything in particular that you want redacted before this is disclosed? If so, please respond with the information you feel needs to be redacted.

Thanks
@coffeecup
